pl: Kamienica Gehanowska Pod Sloncem - It is the only tenement house standing at the Main Square, in which the entrance to the Market Square has been preserved. The history of this house dates back to the Middle Ages, parts of the present building come from the mid-fourteenth century. This house, digested with fire in 1475, was soon rebuilt, and at the turn of the 15th and 16th centuries it was raised by one floor, the spatial arrangement of the interior was determined at the time. The tenement house is located on the AB line, with the southern exposure. The facade of the tenement house was renovated in 2008.
